item.title: How to Safely Uninstall Any Linux Distro from a Windows Dual Boot
item.author: Om Bhatt
item.description: The steps for uninstalling Linux Mint from a Windows dual boot setup are the same for any other Linux distro, be it Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, Arch, etc. 1. Boot into Windows. 2. Open Disk Management: Press Windows + X to open the Power User Menu. Click on Disk Management. 3. Identify the Linux partition: Look for a partition that is formatted with Healthy (Primary Partition) because it is not showing as ext4 (Linux filesystem).
